abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that the project
            created a platform for tourism development and regional
            integration by using an innovative approach to biodiversity
            conservation. In some ways, the potential of this project -
            for achieving regional integration and creating a platform
            for tourism development - was under exploited by the Bank.
            Land demarcations are the first step in ensuring that
            communities are not overwhelmed by private sector operators
            and marginalized during the development process. The
            importance of tourism was not sufficiently recognized until
            the Transfrontier Conservation Areas (TFCA) Unit was
            somewhat fortuitously established. The project created
            institutional capacity within the Ministry of tourism
            (MITUR); however, it took four years for its implementation
            (and five years of preparation). Sensitive issues such as
            communities living in National Parks need to be dealt with
            all stakeholders and to be resolved before approval.
            Inclusion and strengthening of provincial and district
            governments is needed to improve sustainability. Creating an
            enabling environment for the private sector and encouraging
            high quality investors is a difficult and complex challenge.
            In similar projects, an advisor dealing with private sector
            issues should be appointed. In order for a pilot project to
            produce results with new methodologies, an Monitoring &
            Evaluation (M&E) system must be in place. A concerted
            effort is required by Government of Mozambique (GOM), with
            support from the donors, to ensure that communities are not
            marginalized by land allocations and that the true real
            estate values of land are attained through auctions or tenders.
